trans-unit.source: Working with Channels that are Enabled to Perform Live Encoding with Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: Working with Channels that are Enabled to Perform Live Encoding with Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to set up a Channel that receives a single bitrate live stream from an on-premises encoder and then performs live encoding to adaptive bitrate stream with Media Services. The stream can then be delivered to client playback applications through one or more Streaming Endpoints, using one of the following adaptive streaming protocols: HLS, Smooth Stream, MPEG DASH, HDS.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to set up a Channel that receives a single bitrate live stream from an on-premises encoder and then performs live encoding to adaptive bitrate stream with Media Services. The stream can then be delivered to client playback applications through one or more Streaming Endpoints, using one of the following adaptive streaming protocols: HLS, Smooth Stream, MPEG DASH, HDS.

trans-unit.source: Working with Channels that are Enabled to Perform Live Encoding with Azure Media Services (Preview)
trans-unit.target: Working with Channels that are Enabled to Perform Live Encoding with Azure Media Services (Preview)

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In Azure Media Services, a Channel represents a pipeline for processing live streaming content.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Media Services, a Channel represents a pipeline for processing live streaming content.

trans-unit.source: A Channel receives live input streams in one of two ways:
trans-unit.target: A Channel receives live input streams in one of two ways:

trans-unit.source: An on-premises live encoder sends multi-bitrate RTMP or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4) to the Channel.
trans-unit.target: An on-premises live encoder sends multi-bitrate RTMP or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4) to the Channel.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following live encoders that output multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming: Elemental, Envivio, Cisco.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following live encoders that output multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming: Elemental, Envivio, Cisco.

trans-unit.source: The following live encoders output RTMP: Adobe Flash Live, Telestream Wirecast, and Tricaster transcoders.
trans-unit.target: The following live encoders output RTMP: Adobe Flash Live, Telestream Wirecast, and Tricaster transcoders.

trans-unit.source: The ingested streams pass through Channels without any further processing.
trans-unit.target: The ingested streams pass through Channels without any further processing.

trans-unit.source: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.
trans-unit.target: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.

trans-unit.source: A single bitrate stream (in one of the following formats: RTP (MPEG-TS)), RTMP, or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4)) is sent to the Channel that is enabled to perform live encoding with Media Services.
trans-unit.target: A single bitrate stream (in one of the following formats: RTP (MPEG-TS)), RTMP, or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4)) is sent to the Channel that is enabled to perform live encoding with Media Services.

trans-unit.source: The Channel then performs live encoding of the incoming single bitrate stream to a multi-bitrate (adaptive) video stream.
trans-unit.target: The Channel then performs live encoding of the incoming single bitrate stream to a multi-bitrate (adaptive) video stream.

trans-unit.source: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.
trans-unit.target: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.

trans-unit.source: Encoding a live stream with Media Services is currently in Preview.
trans-unit.target: Encoding a live stream with Media Services is currently in Preview.

trans-unit.source: Starting with the Media Services 2.10 release, when you create a Channel, you can specify in which way you want for your channel to receive the input stream and whether or not you want for the channel to perform live encoding of your stream.
trans-unit.target: Starting with the Media Services 2.10 release, when you create a Channel, you can specify in which way you want for your channel to receive the input stream and whether or not you want for the channel to perform live encoding of your stream.

trans-unit.source: You have two options:
trans-unit.target: You have two options:

trans-unit.source: None – Specify this value, if you plan to use an on-premises live encoder which will output multi-bitrate stream.
trans-unit.target: None – Specify this value, if you plan to use an on-premises live encoder which will output multi-bitrate stream.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the incoming stream passed through to the output without any encoding.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the incoming stream passed through to the output without any encoding.

trans-unit.source: This is the behavior of a Channel prior to 2.10 release.
trans-unit.target: This is the behavior of a Channel prior to 2.10 release.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information about working with channels of this type, see <link><linkText>Working with Channels that Receive Multi-bitrate Live Stream from On-premises Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information about working with channels of this type, see <link><linkText>Working with Channels that Receive Multi-bitrate Live Stream from On-premises Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Standard (Preview) – Choose this value, if you plan to use Media Services to encode your single bitrate live stream to multi-bitrate stream.
trans-unit.target: Standard (Preview) – Choose this value, if you plan to use Media Services to encode your single bitrate live stream to multi-bitrate stream.

trans-unit.source: Encoding a live stream with Media Services is currently in Preview.
trans-unit.target: Encoding a live stream with Media Services is currently in Preview.

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses attributes of channels that are enabled to perform live encoding (Standard encoding type).
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses attributes of channels that are enabled to perform live encoding (Standard encoding type).

trans-unit.source: For information about working with channels that are not enabled to perform live encoding, see <link><linkText>Working with Channels that Receive Multi-bitrate Live Stream from On-premises Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about working with channels that are not enabled to perform live encoding, see <link><linkText>Working with Channels that Receive Multi-bitrate Live Stream from On-premises Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram represents a live streaming workflow where a channel receives a single bitrate stream in one of the following protocols: RTMP, Smooth Streaming, or RTP (MPEG-TS); it then encodes the stream to a multi-bitrate stream.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram represents a live streaming workflow where a channel receives a single bitrate stream in one of the following protocols: RTMP, Smooth Streaming, or RTP (MPEG-TS); it then encodes the stream to a multi-bitrate stream.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Live workflow</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Live workflow</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Not all data centers support Live Encoding with Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Not all data centers support Live Encoding with Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure Management Portal to create Channels, you will have two Channel encoding type options available: None and Standard.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure Management Portal to create Channels, you will have two Channel encoding type options available: None and Standard.

trans-unit.source: If you only see the None option, it means your data center does not support Live Encoding with AMS.
trans-unit.target: If you only see the None option, it means your data center does not support Live Encoding with AMS.

trans-unit.source: If you are using .NET SDK or REST API, do the following to check:
trans-unit.target: If you are using .NET SDK or REST API, do the following to check:

trans-unit.source: 1. Try to create a Channel with encoding type set to Standard.
trans-unit.target: 1. Try to create a Channel with encoding type set to Standard.

trans-unit.source: 2. If the returned result HTTP Error Code 412 (Precondition Failed) with the following message: "Live encoding is not supported in this region; EncodingType must be set to 'None'.", your data center does not support Live Encoding.
trans-unit.target: 2. If the returned result HTTP Error Code 412 (Precondition Failed) with the following message: "Live encoding is not supported in this region; EncodingType must be set to 'None'.", your data center does not support Live Encoding.

trans-unit.source: In this topic
trans-unit.target: In this topic

trans-unit.source: Overview of a <link><linkText>common live streaming scenario</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Overview of a <link><linkText>common live streaming scenario</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Description of a Channel and its related components</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Description of a Channel and its related components</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Considerations</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Considerations</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Tasks related to Live Streaming</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Tasks related to Live Streaming</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Common Live Streaming Scenario
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Common Live Streaming Scenario

trans-unit.source: The following are general steps involved in creating common live streaming applications.
trans-unit.target: The following are general steps involved in creating common live streaming applications.

trans-unit.source: Connect a video camera to a computer.
trans-unit.target: Connect a video camera to a computer.

trans-unit.source: Launch and configure an on-premises live encoder that can output a single bitrate stream in one of the following protocols: RTMP, Smooth Streaming, or RTP (MPEG-TS).
trans-unit.target: Launch and configure an on-premises live encoder that can output a single bitrate stream in one of the following protocols: RTMP, Smooth Streaming, or RTP (MPEG-TS).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Media Services RTMP Support and Live Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Media Services RTMP Support and Live Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This step could also be performed after you create your Channel.
trans-unit.target: This step could also be performed after you create your Channel.

trans-unit.source: Create and start a Channel.
trans-unit.target: Create and start a Channel.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the Channel ingest URL.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the Channel ingest URL.

trans-unit.source: The ingest URL is used by the live encoder to send the stream to the Channel.
trans-unit.target: The ingest URL is used by the live encoder to send the stream to the Channel.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the Channel preview URL.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the Channel preview URL.

trans-unit.source: Use this URL to verify that your channel is properly receiving the live stream.
trans-unit.target: Use this URL to verify that your channel is properly receiving the live stream.

trans-unit.source: Create a program.
trans-unit.target: Create a program.

trans-unit.source: When using the Azure Management Portal, creating a program also creates an asset.
trans-unit.target: When using the Azure Management Portal, creating a program also creates an asset.

trans-unit.source: When using .NET SDK or REST you need to create an asset and specify to use this asset when creating a Program.
trans-unit.target: When using .NET SDK or REST you need to create an asset and specify to use this asset when creating a Program.

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset associated with the program.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset associated with the program.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.

trans-unit.source: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.
trans-unit.target: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, the live encoder can be signaled to start an advertisement.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, the live encoder can be signaled to start an advertisement.

trans-unit.source: The advertisement is inserted in the output stream.
trans-unit.target: The advertisement is inserted in the output stream.

trans-unit.source: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.
trans-unit.target: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.

trans-unit.source: Delete the Program (and optionally delete the asset).
trans-unit.target: Delete the Program (and optionally delete the asset).

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>live streaming tasks</linkText><title></title></link> section links to topics that demonstrate how to achieve tasks described above.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>live streaming tasks</linkText><title></title></link> section links to topics that demonstrate how to achieve tasks described above.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Channel's input (ingest) configurations
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Channel's input (ingest) configurations

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Ingest streaming protocol
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Ingest streaming protocol

trans-unit.source: If the Encoder Type is set to Standard, valid options are:
trans-unit.target: If the Encoder Type is set to Standard, valid options are:

trans-unit.source: RTP (MPEG-TS): MPEG-2 Transport Stream over RTP.
trans-unit.target: RTP (MPEG-TS): MPEG-2 Transport Stream over RTP.

trans-unit.source: Single bitrate RTMP
trans-unit.target: Single bitrate RTMP

trans-unit.source: Single bitrate Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming)
trans-unit.target: Single bitrate Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming)

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Media Services RTMP Support and Live Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Media Services RTMP Support and Live Encoders</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: RTP (MPEG-TS) - MPEG-2 Transport Stream over RTP.
trans-unit.target: RTP (MPEG-TS) - MPEG-2 Transport Stream over RTP.

trans-unit.source: Typical use case:
trans-unit.target: Typical use case:

trans-unit.source: Professional broadcasters typically work with high-end on-premises live encoders from vendors like Elemental Technologies, Ericsson, Ateme, Imagine or Envivio to send a stream.
trans-unit.target: Professional broadcasters typically work with high-end on-premises live encoders from vendors like Elemental Technologies, Ericsson, Ateme, Imagine or Envivio to send a stream.

trans-unit.source: Often used in conjunction with an IT department and private networks.
trans-unit.target: Often used in conjunction with an IT department and private networks.

trans-unit.source: Considerations:
trans-unit.target: Considerations:

trans-unit.source: The use of a single program transport stream (SPTS) input is strongly recommended.
trans-unit.target: The use of a single program transport stream (SPTS) input is strongly recommended.

trans-unit.source: The use of multiple language audio tracks, however, is supported
trans-unit.target: The use of multiple language audio tracks, however, is supported

trans-unit.source: The video stream should have an average bitrate below 15 Mbps
trans-unit.target: The video stream should have an average bitrate below 15 Mbps

trans-unit.source: The aggregate average bitrate of the audio streams should be below 1 Mbps
trans-unit.target: The aggregate average bitrate of the audio streams should be below 1 Mbps

trans-unit.source: Following are the supported codecs:
trans-unit.target: Following are the supported codecs:

trans-unit.source: MPEG-2 / H.262 Video
trans-unit.target: MPEG-2 / H.262 Video

trans-unit.source: MPEG-4 AVC / H.264 Video
trans-unit.target: MPEG-4 AVC / H.264 Video

trans-unit.source: MPEG-2 AAC-LC Audio
trans-unit.target: MPEG-2 AAC-LC Audio

trans-unit.source: Dolby Digital (AC-3) Audio
trans-unit.target: Dolby Digital (AC-3) Audio

trans-unit.source: MPEG Audio (Layer II and III)
trans-unit.target: MPEG Audio (Layer II and III)

trans-unit.source: Recommended broadcast encoders include:
trans-unit.target: Recommended broadcast encoders include:

trans-unit.source: Ateme AM2102
trans-unit.target: Ateme AM2102

trans-unit.source: Ericsson AVP2000
trans-unit.target: Ericsson AVP2000

trans-unit.source: eVertz 3480
trans-unit.target: eVertz 3480

trans-unit.source: Ericsson RX8200
trans-unit.target: Ericsson RX8200

trans-unit.source: Imagine Communications Selenio ENC 1
trans-unit.target: Imagine Communications Selenio ENC 1

trans-unit.source: Imagine Communications Selenio ENC 2
trans-unit.target: Imagine Communications Selenio ENC 2

trans-unit.source: AdTec EN-30
trans-unit.target: AdTec EN-30

trans-unit.source: AdTec EN-91P
trans-unit.target: AdTec EN-91P

trans-unit.source: AdTec EN-100
trans-unit.target: AdTec EN-100

trans-unit.source: Harmonic ProStream 1000
trans-unit.target: Harmonic ProStream 1000

trans-unit.source: Thor H-2 4HD-EM
trans-unit.target: Thor H-2 4HD-EM

trans-unit.source: eVertz 7880 SLKE
trans-unit.target: eVertz 7880 SLKE

trans-unit.source: Cisco Spinnaker
trans-unit.target: Cisco Spinnaker

trans-unit.source: Elemental Live
trans-unit.target: Elemental Live

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Single bitrate RTMP
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Single bitrate RTMP

trans-unit.source: Considerations:
trans-unit.target: Considerations:

trans-unit.source: The incoming stream cannot contain multi-bitrate video
trans-unit.target: The incoming stream cannot contain multi-bitrate video

trans-unit.source: The video stream should have an average bitrate below 15 Mbps
trans-unit.target: The video stream should have an average bitrate below 15 Mbps

trans-unit.source: The audio stream should have an average bitrate below 1 Mbps
trans-unit.target: The audio stream should have an average bitrate below 1 Mbps

trans-unit.source: Following are the supported codecs:
trans-unit.target: Following are the supported codecs:

trans-unit.source: MPEG-4 AVC / H.264 Video
trans-unit.target: MPEG-4 AVC / H.264 Video

trans-unit.source: MPEG-2 AAC-LC Audio
trans-unit.target: MPEG-2 AAC-LC Audio

trans-unit.source: Recommended encoders include:
trans-unit.target: Recommended encoders include:

trans-unit.source: Telestream Wirecast
trans-unit.target: Telestream Wirecast

trans-unit.source: Flash Media Live Encoder
trans-unit.target: Flash Media Live Encoder

trans-unit.source: Tricaster
trans-unit.target: Tricaster

trans-unit.source: Single bitrate Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming)
trans-unit.target: Single bitrate Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming)

trans-unit.source: Typical use case:
trans-unit.target: Typical use case:

trans-unit.source: Use on-premises live encoders from vendors like Elemental Technologies, Ericsson, Ateme, Envivio to send the input stream over the open internet to a nearby Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: Use on-premises live encoders from vendors like Elemental Technologies, Ericsson, Ateme, Envivio to send the input stream over the open internet to a nearby Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: Considerations:
trans-unit.target: Considerations:

trans-unit.source: Same as for <link><linkText>single bitrate RTMP</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Same as for <link><linkText>single bitrate RTMP</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Other considerations
trans-unit.target: Other considerations

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.

trans-unit.source: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.
trans-unit.target: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.

trans-unit.source: Maximum resolution for the incoming video stream is 1920x1080, and at most 60 fields/second if interlaced, or 30 frames/second if progressive.
trans-unit.target: Maximum resolution for the incoming video stream is 1920x1080, and at most 60 fields/second if interlaced, or 30 frames/second if progressive.

trans-unit.source: Ingest URLs (endpoints)
trans-unit.target: Ingest URLs (endpoints)

trans-unit.source: A Channel provides an input endpoint (ingest URL) that you specify in the live encoder, so the encoder can push streams to your Channels.
trans-unit.target: A Channel provides an input endpoint (ingest URL) that you specify in the live encoder, so the encoder can push streams to your Channels.

trans-unit.source: You can get the ingest URLs once you create a Channel.
trans-unit.target: You can get the ingest URLs once you create a Channel.

trans-unit.source: To get these URLs, the Channel does not have to be in the Running state.
trans-unit.target: To get these URLs, the Channel does not have to be in the Running state.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready to start pushing data into the Channel, it must be in the Running state.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready to start pushing data into the Channel, it must be in the Running state.

trans-unit.source: Once the Channel starts ingesting data, you can preview your stream through the preview URL.
trans-unit.target: Once the Channel starts ingesting data, you can preview your stream through the preview URL.

trans-unit.source: You have an option of ingesting Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming) live stream over an SSL connection.
trans-unit.target: You have an option of ingesting Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming) live stream over an SSL connection.

trans-unit.source: To ingest over SSL, make sure to update the ingest URL to HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: To ingest over SSL, make sure to update the ingest URL to HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: Allowed IP addresses
trans-unit.target: Allowed IP addresses

trans-unit.source: You can define the IP addresses that are allowed to publish video to this channel.
trans-unit.target: You can define the IP addresses that are allowed to publish video to this channel.

trans-unit.source: Allowed IP addresses can be specified as either a single IP address (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1’), an IP range using an IP address and a CIDR subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1/22’), or an IP range using an IP address and a dotted decimal subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1(255.255.252.0)’).
trans-unit.target: Allowed IP addresses can be specified as either a single IP address (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1’), an IP range using an IP address and a CIDR subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1/22’), or an IP range using an IP address and a dotted decimal subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1(255.255.252.0)’).

trans-unit.source: If no IP addresses are specified and there is no rule definition then no IP address will be allowed.
trans-unit.target: If no IP addresses are specified and there is no rule definition then no IP address will be allowed.

trans-unit.source: To allow any IP address, create a rule and set 0.0.0.0/0.
trans-unit.target: To allow any IP address, create a rule and set 0.0.0.0/0.

trans-unit.source: Channel preview
trans-unit.target: Channel preview

trans-unit.source: Preview URLs
trans-unit.target: Preview URLs

trans-unit.source: Channels provide a preview endpoint (preview URL) that you use to preview and validate your stream before further processing and delivery.
trans-unit.target: Channels provide a preview endpoint (preview URL) that you use to preview and validate your stream before further processing and delivery.

trans-unit.source: You can get the preview URL when you create the channel.
trans-unit.target: You can get the preview URL when you create the channel.

trans-unit.source: To get the URL, the channel does not have to be in the Running state.
trans-unit.target: To get the URL, the channel does not have to be in the Running state.

trans-unit.source: Once the Channel starts ingesting data, you can preview your stream.
trans-unit.target: Once the Channel starts ingesting data, you can preview your stream.

trans-unit.source: Note Currently the preview stream can only be delivered in Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming) format regardless of the specified input type.
trans-unit.target: Note Currently the preview stream can only be delivered in Fragmented MP4 (Smooth Streaming) format regardless of the specified input type.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link><linkText>http://smf.cloudapp.net/healthmonitor</linkText><title></title></link> player to test the Smooth Stream.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link><linkText>http://smf.cloudapp.net/healthmonitor</linkText><title></title></link> player to test the Smooth Stream.

trans-unit.source: You can also use a player hosted in the Azure Management Portal to view your stream.
trans-unit.target: You can also use a player hosted in the Azure Management Portal to view your stream.

trans-unit.source: Allowed IP Addresses
trans-unit.target: Allowed IP Addresses

trans-unit.source: You can define the IP addresses that are allowed to connect to the preview endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You can define the IP addresses that are allowed to connect to the preview endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If no IP addresses are specified any IP address will be allowed.
trans-unit.target: If no IP addresses are specified any IP address will be allowed.

trans-unit.source: Allowed IP addresses can be specified as either a single IP address (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1’), an IP range using an IP address and a CIDR subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1/22’), or an IP range using an IP address and a dotted decimal subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1(255.255.252.0)’).
trans-unit.target: Allowed IP addresses can be specified as either a single IP address (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1’), an IP range using an IP address and a CIDR subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1/22’), or an IP range using an IP address and a dotted decimal subnet mask (e.g. ‘10.0.0.1(255.255.252.0)’).

trans-unit.source: Live encoding settings
trans-unit.target: Live encoding settings

trans-unit.source: This section describes how the settings for the live encoder within the Channel can be adjusted, when the Encoding Type of a Channel is set to Standard.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how the settings for the live encoder within the Channel can be adjusted, when the Encoding Type of a Channel is set to Standard.

trans-unit.source: Ad marker source
trans-unit.target: Ad marker source

trans-unit.source: You can specify the source for ad markers signals.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the source for ad markers signals.

trans-unit.source: Default value is Api, which indicates that the live encoder within the Channel should listen to an asynchronous Ad Marker API.
trans-unit.target: Default value is Api, which indicates that the live encoder within the Channel should listen to an asynchronous Ad Marker API.

trans-unit.source: The other valid option is Scte35 (allowed only if the ingest streaming protocol is set to RTP (MPEG-TS).
trans-unit.target: The other valid option is Scte35 (allowed only if the ingest streaming protocol is set to RTP (MPEG-TS).

trans-unit.source: When Scte35 is specified, the live encoder will parse SCTE-35 signals from the input RTP (MPEG-TS) stream.
trans-unit.target: When Scte35 is specified, the live encoder will parse SCTE-35 signals from the input RTP (MPEG-TS) stream.

trans-unit.source: CEA 708 Closed Captions
trans-unit.target: CEA 708 Closed Captions

trans-unit.source: An optional flag which tells the live encoder to ignore any CEA 708 captions data embedded in the incoming video.
trans-unit.target: An optional flag which tells the live encoder to ignore any CEA 708 captions data embedded in the incoming video.

trans-unit.source: When the flag is set to false (default), the encoder will detect and re-insert CEA 708 data into the output video streams.
trans-unit.target: When the flag is set to false (default), the encoder will detect and re-insert CEA 708 data into the output video streams.

trans-unit.source: Video Stream
trans-unit.target: Video Stream

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Describes the input video stream.
trans-unit.target: Describes the input video stream.

trans-unit.source: If this field is not specified, the default value is used.
trans-unit.target: If this field is not specified, the default value is used.

trans-unit.source: This setting is allowed only if the input streaming protocol is set to RTP (MPEG-TS).
trans-unit.target: This setting is allowed only if the input streaming protocol is set to RTP (MPEG-TS).

trans-unit.source: Index
trans-unit.target: Index

trans-unit.source: A zero-based index that specifies which input video stream should be processed by the live encoder within the Channel.
trans-unit.target: A zero-based index that specifies which input video stream should be processed by the live encoder within the Channel.

trans-unit.source: This setting applies only if ingest streaming protocol is RTP (MPEG-TS).
trans-unit.target: This setting applies only if ingest streaming protocol is RTP (MPEG-TS).

trans-unit.source: Default value is zero.
trans-unit.target: Default value is zero.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to send in a single program transport stream (SPTS).
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to send in a single program transport stream (SPTS).

trans-unit.source: If the input stream contains multiple programs, the live encoder parses the Program Map Table (PMT) in the input, identifies the inputs that have a stream type name of MPEG-2 Video or H.264, and arranges them in the order specified in the PMT.
trans-unit.target: If the input stream contains multiple programs, the live encoder parses the Program Map Table (PMT) in the input, identifies the inputs that have a stream type name of MPEG-2 Video or H.264, and arranges them in the order specified in the PMT.

trans-unit.source: The zero-based index is then used to pick up the n-th entry in that arrangement.
trans-unit.target: The zero-based index is then used to pick up the n-th entry in that arrangement.

trans-unit.source: Audio Stream
trans-unit.target: Audio Stream

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Describes the input audio streams.
trans-unit.target: Describes the input audio streams.

trans-unit.source: If this field is not specified, the default values specified apply.
trans-unit.target: If this field is not specified, the default values specified apply.

trans-unit.source: This setting is allowed only if the input streaming protocol is set to RTP (MPEG-TS).
trans-unit.target: This setting is allowed only if the input streaming protocol is set to RTP (MPEG-TS).

trans-unit.source: Index
trans-unit.target: Index

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to send in a single program transport stream (SPTS).
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to send in a single program transport stream (SPTS).

trans-unit.source: If the input stream contains multiple programs, the live encoder within the Channel parses the Program Map Table (PMT) in the input, identifies the inputs that have a stream type name of MPEG-2 AAC ADTS or AC-3 System-A or AC-3 System-B or MPEG-2 Private PES or MPEG-1 Audio or MPEG-2 Audio, and arranges them in the order specified in the PMT.
trans-unit.target: If the input stream contains multiple programs, the live encoder within the Channel parses the Program Map Table (PMT) in the input, identifies the inputs that have a stream type name of MPEG-2 AAC ADTS or AC-3 System-A or AC-3 System-B or MPEG-2 Private PES or MPEG-1 Audio or MPEG-2 Audio, and arranges them in the order specified in the PMT.

trans-unit.source: The zero-based index is then used to pick up the n-th entry in that arrangement.
trans-unit.target: The zero-based index is then used to pick up the n-th entry in that arrangement.

trans-unit.source: Language
trans-unit.target: Language

trans-unit.source: The language identifier of the audio stream, conforming to ISO 639-2, such as ENG.
trans-unit.target: The language identifier of the audio stream, conforming to ISO 639-2, such as ENG.

trans-unit.source: If not present, the default is UND (undefined).
trans-unit.target: If not present, the default is UND (undefined).

trans-unit.source: There can be up to 8 audio stream sets specified if the input to the Channel is MPEG-2 TS over RTP.
trans-unit.target: There can be up to 8 audio stream sets specified if the input to the Channel is MPEG-2 TS over RTP.

trans-unit.source: However, there can be no two entries with the same value of Index.
trans-unit.target: However, there can be no two entries with the same value of Index.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>System Preset
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>System Preset

trans-unit.source: Specifies the preset to be used by the live encoder within this Channel.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the preset to be used by the live encoder within this Channel.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the only allowed value is Default720p (default).
trans-unit.target: Currently, the only allowed value is Default720p (default).

trans-unit.source: Default720p will encode the video into the following 7 layers.
trans-unit.target: Default720p will encode the video into the following 7 layers.

trans-unit.source: Output Video Stream
trans-unit.target: Output Video Stream

trans-unit.target: BitRate

trans-unit.target: Width

trans-unit.source: Height
trans-unit.target: Height

trans-unit.target: MaxFPS

trans-unit.target: Profile

trans-unit.target: Output Stream Name

trans-unit.target: High

trans-unit.source: Output Audio Stream
trans-unit.target: Output Audio Stream

trans-unit.source: Audio is encoded to stereo AAC-LC at 64 kbps, sampling rate of 44.1 kHz.
trans-unit.target: Audio is encoded to stereo AAC-LC at 64 kbps, sampling rate of 44.1 kHz.

trans-unit.source: Signaling Advertisements
trans-unit.target: Signaling Advertisements

trans-unit.source: When your Channel has Live Encoding enabled, you have a component in your pipeline that is processing video, and can manipulate it.
trans-unit.target: When your Channel has Live Encoding enabled, you have a component in your pipeline that is processing video, and can manipulate it.

trans-unit.source: You can signal for the Channel to insert slates and/or advertisements into the outgoing adaptive bitrate stream.
trans-unit.target: You can signal for the Channel to insert slates and/or advertisements into the outgoing adaptive bitrate stream.

trans-unit.source: Slates are still images that you can use to cover up the input live feed in certain cases (for example during a commercial break).
trans-unit.target: Slates are still images that you can use to cover up the input live feed in certain cases (for example during a commercial break).

trans-unit.source: Advertising signals, are time-synchronized signals you embed into the outgoing stream to tell the video player to take special action – such as to switch to an advertisement at the appropriate time.
trans-unit.target: Advertising signals, are time-synchronized signals you embed into the outgoing stream to tell the video player to take special action – such as to switch to an advertisement at the appropriate time.

trans-unit.source: See this <link><linkText>blog</linkText><title></title></link> for an overview of the SCTE-35 signaling mechanism used for this purpose.
trans-unit.target: See this <link><linkText>blog</linkText><title></title></link> for an overview of the SCTE-35 signaling mechanism used for this purpose.

trans-unit.source: Below is a typical scenario you could implement in your live event.
trans-unit.target: Below is a typical scenario you could implement in your live event.

trans-unit.source: Have your viewers get a PRE-EVENT image before the event starts.
trans-unit.target: Have your viewers get a PRE-EVENT image before the event starts.

trans-unit.source: Have your viewers get a POST-EVENT image after the event ends.
trans-unit.target: Have your viewers get a POST-EVENT image after the event ends.

trans-unit.source: Have your viewers get an ERROR-EVENT image if there is a problem during the event (for example, power failure in the stadium).
trans-unit.target: Have your viewers get an ERROR-EVENT image if there is a problem during the event (for example, power failure in the stadium).

trans-unit.source: Send an AD-BREAK image to hide the live event feed during a commercial break.
trans-unit.target: Send an AD-BREAK image to hide the live event feed during a commercial break.

trans-unit.source: The following are the properties you can set when signaling advertisements.
trans-unit.target: The following are the properties you can set when signaling advertisements.

trans-unit.source: Duration
trans-unit.target: Duration

trans-unit.source: The duration, in seconds, of the commercial break.
trans-unit.target: The duration, in seconds, of the commercial break.

trans-unit.source: This has to be a non-zero positive value in order to start the commercial break.
trans-unit.target: This has to be a non-zero positive value in order to start the commercial break.

trans-unit.source: When a commercial break is in progress, and the duration is set to zero with the CueId matching the on-going commercial break, then that break is canceled.
trans-unit.target: When a commercial break is in progress, and the duration is set to zero with the CueId matching the on-going commercial break, then that break is canceled.

trans-unit.source: CueId
trans-unit.target: CueId

trans-unit.source: A Unique ID for the commercial break, to be used by downstream application to take appropriate action(s).
trans-unit.target: A Unique ID for the commercial break, to be used by downstream application to take appropriate action(s).

trans-unit.source: Needs to be a positive integer.
trans-unit.target: Needs to be a positive integer.

trans-unit.source: You can set this value to any random positive integer or use an upstream system to track the Cue Ids.
trans-unit.target: You can set this value to any random positive integer or use an upstream system to track the Cue Ids.

trans-unit.source: Make certain to normalize any ids to positive integers before submitting through the API.
trans-unit.target: Make certain to normalize any ids to positive integers before submitting through the API.

trans-unit.source: Show slate
trans-unit.target: Show slate

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Signals the live encoder to switch to the <link><linkText>default slate</linkText><title></title></link> image during a commercial break and hide the incoming video feed.
trans-unit.target: Signals the live encoder to switch to the <link><linkText>default slate</linkText><title></title></link> image during a commercial break and hide the incoming video feed.

trans-unit.source: Audio is also muted during slate.
trans-unit.target: Audio is also muted during slate.

trans-unit.source: Default is false.
trans-unit.target: Default is false.

trans-unit.source: The image used will be the one specified via the default slate asset Id property at the time of the channel creation.
trans-unit.target: The image used will be the one specified via the default slate asset Id property at the time of the channel creation.

trans-unit.source: The slate will be stretched to fit the display image size.
trans-unit.target: The slate will be stretched to fit the display image size.

trans-unit.source: Insert Slate images
trans-unit.target: Insert Slate images

trans-unit.source: The live encoder within the Channel can be signaled to switch to a slate image.
trans-unit.target: The live encoder within the Channel can be signaled to switch to a slate image.

trans-unit.source: It can also be signaled to end an on-going slate.
trans-unit.target: It can also be signaled to end an on-going slate.

trans-unit.source: The live encoder can be configured to switch to a slate image and hide the incoming video signal in certain situations – for example, during an ad break.
trans-unit.target: The live encoder can be configured to switch to a slate image and hide the incoming video signal in certain situations – for example, during an ad break.

trans-unit.source: If such a slate is not configured, input video is not masked during that ad break.
trans-unit.target: If such a slate is not configured, input video is not masked during that ad break.

trans-unit.source: Duration
trans-unit.target: Duration

trans-unit.source: The duration of the slate in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The duration of the slate in seconds.

trans-unit.source: This has to be a non-zero positive value in order to start the slate.
trans-unit.target: This has to be a non-zero positive value in order to start the slate.

trans-unit.source: If there is an on-going slate, and a duration of zero is specified, then that on-going slate will be terminated.
trans-unit.target: If there is an on-going slate, and a duration of zero is specified, then that on-going slate will be terminated.

trans-unit.source: Insert slate on ad marker
trans-unit.target: Insert slate on ad marker

trans-unit.source: When set to true, this setting configures the live encoder to insert a slate image during an ad break.
trans-unit.target: When set to true, this setting configures the live encoder to insert a slate image during an ad break.

trans-unit.source: The default value is true.
trans-unit.target: The default value is true.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Default slate Asset Id
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Default slate Asset Id

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Asset Id of the Media Services Asset which contains the slate image.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Asset Id of the Media Services Asset which contains the slate image.

trans-unit.source: Default is null.
trans-unit.target: Default is null.

trans-unit.source: Note: Before creating the Channel, the slate image with the following constraints should be uploaded as a dedicated asset (no other files should be in this asset).
trans-unit.target: Note: Before creating the Channel, the slate image with the following constraints should be uploaded as a dedicated asset (no other files should be in this asset).

trans-unit.source: At most 1920x1080 in resolution.
trans-unit.target: At most 1920x1080 in resolution.

trans-unit.source: At most 3 Mbytes in size.
trans-unit.target: At most 3 Mbytes in size.

trans-unit.source: The file name must have a *.jpg extension.
trans-unit.target: The file name must have a *.jpg extension.

trans-unit.source: The image must be uploaded into an Asset as the only AssetFile in that Asset and this AssetFile should be marked as the primary file.
trans-unit.target: The image must be uploaded into an Asset as the only AssetFile in that Asset and this AssetFile should be marked as the primary file.

trans-unit.source: The Asset cannot be storage encrypted.
trans-unit.target: The Asset cannot be storage encrypted.

trans-unit.source: If the default slate Asset Id is not specified, and insert slate on ad marker is set to true, a default Azure Media Services image will be used to hide the input video stream.
trans-unit.target: If the default slate Asset Id is not specified, and insert slate on ad marker is set to true, a default Azure Media Services image will be used to hide the input video stream.

trans-unit.source: Audio is also muted during slate.
trans-unit.target: Audio is also muted during slate.

trans-unit.source: Channel's programs
trans-unit.target: Channel's programs

trans-unit.source: A channel is associated with programs that enable you to control the publishing and storage of segments in a live stream.
trans-unit.target: A channel is associated with programs that enable you to control the publishing and storage of segments in a live stream.

trans-unit.source: Channels manage Programs.
trans-unit.target: Channels manage Programs.

trans-unit.source: The Channel and Program relationship is very similar to traditional media where a Channel has a constant stream of content and a program is scoped to some timed event on that Channel.
trans-unit.target: The Channel and Program relationship is very similar to traditional media where a Channel has a constant stream of content and a program is scoped to some timed event on that Channel.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the number of hours you want to retain the recorded content for the program by setting the Archive Window length.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the number of hours you want to retain the recorded content for the program by setting the Archive Window length.

trans-unit.source: This value can be set from a minimum of 5 minutes to a maximum of 25 hours.
trans-unit.target: This value can be set from a minimum of 5 minutes to a maximum of 25 hours.

trans-unit.source: Archive window length also dictates the maximum amount of time clients can seek back in time from the current live position.
trans-unit.target: Archive window length also dictates the maximum amount of time clients can seek back in time from the current live position.

trans-unit.source: Programs can run over the specified amount of time, but content that falls behind the window length is continuously discarded.
trans-unit.target: Programs can run over the specified amount of time, but content that falls behind the window length is continuously discarded.

trans-unit.source: This value of this property also determines how long the client manifests can grow.
trans-unit.target: This value of this property also determines how long the client manifests can grow.

trans-unit.source: Each program is associated with an Asset which stores the streamed content.
trans-unit.target: Each program is associated with an Asset which stores the streamed content.

trans-unit.source: An asset is mapped to a blob container in the Azure Storage account and the files in the asset are stored as blobs in that container.
trans-unit.target: An asset is mapped to a blob container in the Azure Storage account and the files in the asset are stored as blobs in that container.

trans-unit.source: To publish the program so your customers can view the stream you must create an OnDemand locator for the associated asset.
trans-unit.target: To publish the program so your customers can view the stream you must create an OnDemand locator for the associated asset.

trans-unit.source: Having this locator will enable you to build a streaming URL that you can provide to your clients.
trans-unit.target: Having this locator will enable you to build a streaming URL that you can provide to your clients.

trans-unit.source: A Channel supports up to three concurrently running programs so you can create multiple archives of the same incoming stream.
trans-unit.target: A Channel supports up to three concurrently running programs so you can create multiple archives of the same incoming stream.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to publish and archive different parts of an event as needed.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to publish and archive different parts of an event as needed.

trans-unit.source: For example, your business requirement is to archive 6 hours of a program, but to broadcast only last 10 minutes.
trans-unit.target: For example, your business requirement is to archive 6 hours of a program, but to broadcast only last 10 minutes.

trans-unit.source: To accomplish this, you need to create two concurrently running programs.
trans-unit.target: To accomplish this, you need to create two concurrently running programs.

trans-unit.source: One program is set to archive 6 hours of the event but the program is not published.
trans-unit.target: One program is set to archive 6 hours of the event but the program is not published.

trans-unit.source: The other program is set to archive for 10 minutes and this program is published.
trans-unit.target: The other program is set to archive for 10 minutes and this program is published.

trans-unit.source: You should not reuse existing programs for new events.
trans-unit.target: You should not reuse existing programs for new events.

trans-unit.source: Instead, create and start a new program for each event as described in the Programming Live Streaming Applications section.
trans-unit.target: Instead, create and start a new program for each event as described in the Programming Live Streaming Applications section.

trans-unit.source: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.
trans-unit.target: Start the program when you are ready to start streaming and archiving.

trans-unit.source: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.
trans-unit.target: Stop the program whenever you want to stop streaming and archiving the event.

trans-unit.source: To delete archived content, stop and delete the program and then delete the associated asset.
trans-unit.target: To delete archived content, stop and delete the program and then delete the associated asset.

trans-unit.source: An asset cannot be deleted if it is used by a program; the program must be deleted first.
trans-unit.target: An asset cannot be deleted if it is used by a program; the program must be deleted first.

trans-unit.source: Even after you stop and delete the program, the users would be able to stream your archived content as a video on demand, for as long as you do not delete the asset.
trans-unit.target: Even after you stop and delete the program, the users would be able to stream your archived content as a video on demand, for as long as you do not delete the asset.

trans-unit.source: If you do want to retain the archived content, but not have it available for streaming, delete the streaming locator.
trans-unit.target: If you do want to retain the archived content, but not have it available for streaming, delete the streaming locator.

trans-unit.source: Getting a thumbnail preview of a live feed
trans-unit.target: Getting a thumbnail preview of a live feed

trans-unit.source: When Live Encoding is enabled, you can now get a preview of the live feed as it reaches the Channel.
trans-unit.target: When Live Encoding is enabled, you can now get a preview of the live feed as it reaches the Channel.

trans-unit.source: This can be a valuable tool to check whether your live feed is actually reaching the Channel.
trans-unit.target: This can be a valuable tool to check whether your live feed is actually reaching the Channel.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Channel states and how states map to the billing mode
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Channel states and how states map to the billing mode

trans-unit.source: The current state of a Channel.
trans-unit.target: The current state of a Channel.

trans-unit.source: Possible values include:
trans-unit.target: Possible values include:

trans-unit.source: Stopped.
trans-unit.target: Stopped.

trans-unit.source: This is the initial state of the Channel after its creation.
trans-unit.target: This is the initial state of the Channel after its creation.

trans-unit.source: In this state, the Channel properties can be updated but streaming is not allowed.
trans-unit.target: In this state, the Channel properties can be updated but streaming is not allowed.

trans-unit.source: Starting.
trans-unit.target: Starting.

trans-unit.source: The Channel is being started.
trans-unit.target: The Channel is being started.

trans-unit.source: No updates or streaming is allowed during this state.
trans-unit.target: No updates or streaming is allowed during this state.

trans-unit.source: If an error occurs, the Channel returns to the Stopped state.
trans-unit.target: If an error occurs, the Channel returns to the Stopped state.

trans-unit.source: Running.
trans-unit.target: Running.

trans-unit.source: The Channel is capable of processing live streams.
trans-unit.target: The Channel is capable of processing live streams.

trans-unit.source: Stopping.
trans-unit.target: Stopping.

trans-unit.source: The Channel is being stopped.
trans-unit.target: The Channel is being stopped.

trans-unit.source: No updates or streaming is allowed during this state.
trans-unit.target: No updates or streaming is allowed during this state.

trans-unit.source: Deleting.
trans-unit.target: Deleting.

trans-unit.source: The Channel is being deleted.
trans-unit.target: The Channel is being deleted.

trans-unit.source: No updates or streaming is allowed during this state.
trans-unit.target: No updates or streaming is allowed during this state.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows how Channel states map to the billing mode.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows how Channel states map to the billing mode.

trans-unit.source: Channel state
trans-unit.target: Channel state

trans-unit.target: Portal UI Indicators

trans-unit.target: Billed?

trans-unit.target: Starting

trans-unit.target: Starting

trans-unit.target: No (transient state)

trans-unit.target: Running

trans-unit.target: Ready (no running programs)<html></html>or<html></html>Streaming (at least one running program)

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.target: Stopping

trans-unit.target: Stopping

trans-unit.target: No (transient state)

trans-unit.target: Stopped

trans-unit.target: Stopped

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Currently in Preview, the Channel start can take up to 20+ minutes.
trans-unit.target: Currently in Preview, the Channel start can take up to 20+ minutes.

trans-unit.source: Channel reset can take up to 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Channel reset can take up to 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Considerations
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Considerations

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.

trans-unit.source: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.
trans-unit.target: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.

trans-unit.source: Every time you reconfigure the live encoder, call the Reset method on the channel.
trans-unit.target: Every time you reconfigure the live encoder, call the Reset method on the channel.

trans-unit.source: Before you reset the channel, you have to stop the program.
trans-unit.target: Before you reset the channel, you have to stop the program.

trans-unit.source: After you reset the channel, restart the program.
trans-unit.target: After you reset the channel, restart the program.

trans-unit.source: A channel can be stopped only when it is in the Running state, and all programs on the channel have been stopped.
trans-unit.target: A channel can be stopped only when it is in the Running state, and all programs on the channel have been stopped.

trans-unit.source: By default you can only add 5 channels to your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: By default you can only add 5 channels to your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: This is a soft quota on all new accounts.
trans-unit.target: This is a soft quota on all new accounts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Quotas and Limitations</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Quotas and Limitations</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the input protocol while the Channel or its associated programs are running.

trans-unit.source: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.
trans-unit.target: If you require different protocols, you should create separate channels for each input protocol.

trans-unit.source: You are only billed when your Channel is in the Running state.
trans-unit.target: You are only billed when your Channel is in the Running state.

trans-unit.source: For more information, refer to <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information, refer to <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> section.

trans-unit.source: Known Issues
trans-unit.target: Known Issues

trans-unit.source: Channel start up can take 20+ minutes.
trans-unit.target: Channel start up can take 20+ minutes.

trans-unit.source: RTP support is catered towards professional broadcasters.
trans-unit.target: RTP support is catered towards professional broadcasters.

trans-unit.source: Please review the notes on RTP in <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> blog.
trans-unit.target: Please review the notes on RTP in <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> blog.

trans-unit.source: Slate images should conform to restrictions described <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Slate images should conform to restrictions described <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt create a Channel with a default slate that is larger than 1920x1080, the request will eventually error out.
trans-unit.target: If you attempt create a Channel with a default slate that is larger than 1920x1080, the request will eventually error out.

trans-unit.source: How to create channels that perform live encoding from a singe bitrate to adaptive bitrate stream
trans-unit.target: How to create channels that perform live encoding from a singe bitrate to adaptive bitrate stream

trans-unit.source: Choose Portal, .NET, REST API to see how to create and manage channels and programs.
trans-unit.target: Choose Portal, .NET, REST API to see how to create and manage channels and programs.
